Aura Art - Traditional Chinese Painting Workshop
description: Join a traditional Chinese painting workshop, considered one of the oldest continuous artistic traditions in the world, and take your masterpiece home! Book a session through Klook for a hassle-free experience
summary: Grab a brush and ink and try the art of Chinese painting! This art form will allow you to express your creativity, calm your mind, and allow you to appreciate the beauty of art and nature. Known as guÃ³ huÃ  or native painting, traditional Chinese painting is considered one of the oldest continuous artistic traditions in the world. It uses "Shui Mo" (water and ink), which is a freestyle technique created using a brush dipped in ink and water, and onto rice paper. During this hour and a half lesson, you'll learn different brush strokes, as well as get a solid introduction to the oriental materials, tools, and the painting subject from a professional tutor. You can take your fabulous masterpiece home, serving as a great souvenir from your Hong Kong trip! This class is perfect for friends and family, and no previous experience is required.
highlights: Experience one of the oldest continuous artistic traditions in the world: traditional Chinese painting!
Get a solid introduction to the materials tools, subjects, and brush strokes from a professional tutor
Take your masterpiece home! This will serve as a great souvenir from your unforgettable Hong Kong trip
You don't need to have an artist's hands. This class is perfect for beginners and skillful artists alike

title: Aura Art - Seal Carving Workshop | Central
description: Try your hand at seal carving in this workshop by Aura Art! Learn more about China's ancient history through a step-by-step process of the traditional art form. Get discounts when you book through Klook!
summary: Back in the old days of China, seals were symbols of authority and power. These pocket-size stamps were used exclusively by the government to signify the importance of a document and the owner. Only the most talented craftsmen were trained to carve intricate Chinese characters into seals, a specialization that built seal carving schools throughout the country. But today, the once mysterious traditional art form can now be learned through an hour-long workshop at Aura Art in Hong Kong. Gain basic skills with the help of an expert tutor in just a short amount of time and be able to create your own right after the class. Learn the use of each and every tool laid out on your table - all of which you can use for as long as you want. Follow a simple pattern on a sample by watching your tutor's step-by-step demonstration. Once you get the hang of it, you can now chisel away and recreate a Chinese character you like. End the class with your finished product that will serve well as a great souvenir of your Hong Kong trip. Join the workshop now through Klook!
highlights: Try your hand at seal carving with this workshop by Aura Art!
Learn more about the traditional art of seal carving as you follow your expert tutor's lead
Personalize your handmade stamp by carving a unique Chinese character that represents you
Take your stamp back home as a souvenir or use it as your new signature for letters
Check out other traditional art workshops, such as Chinese Painting, Printmaking, Neon Light Art or Mosaic Art

title: Aura Art® - Printmaking Art Workshop | Causeway Bay
description: Bring your creative ideas to life with a printmaking art workshop in Hong Kong. You'll leave this 1.5 hour workshop with knowledge and a one-of-a-kind souvenir. Visit Klook for more information.
summary: Venture into the exciting world of printmaking in an hour and a half printmaking art workshop. Printmaking is a unique and beautiful art form that's not well understood outside the art world, despite having been around for thousands of years since the invention of paper. This involves transferring an image from a plate or block to a piece of paper, usually with the intention of making multiple identical copies. And with this art workshop, you can try your hand at printmaking as you follow the lead of an English-speaking printmaking master. Come as you are, because all the tools and materials you need are already here. You'll leave this session with new knowledge—and a one-of-a-kind souvenir!
highlights: Bring out your inner artist in this hour and a half printmaking art workshop!
Use blocks and paper as your springboard for ideas, as this hands-on workshop encourages experimenting with prints
Learn from the best, with an English-speaking teacher with years of printmaking experience
Leave the class with a one-of-a-kind souvenir that you can keep or give as a gift to friends!

summary: Macramé is a form of fiber art which is unlike crochet or knitting, it is done without tools but by knotting with hands. Its rich history can be dated back centuries when ancients used decorative knots to secure the excess thread of woven pieces. It peaked high popularity in Victorian period and Queen Mary even taught her ladies-in-waiting macrame class! You can find many macramé decoration on fashion, curtains, tablecloths from that period. Now, macramé is making a huge return, let’s bring home with your unique piece with this historic knotting techniques. **Suitable for age above 11**
highlights: Pick the color which speaks to you and create your unique art piece

In the class, you will get to learn the basic techniques of creating a hand-built ceramic piece, you will get to experience how the chemistry works together between clay & glaze.

Each theme will have 2 classes in total. Class 1 - shaping, class 2 - glazing. You only need to select the class time for your first class, we will contact you to book the second class after your works finish firing.
Hand-build ceramic cup / mug workshop: Shaping your work with a clay slab, you will get to experience the connection between clay & time/water.
Hand-build ceramic plate workshop: There are different techniques you may use to hand-build a ceramic plate. Plaster casting is one of the most popular methods in the industry.
Hand-build ceramic bowl workshop: Using the hand-build technique to build a ceramic bowl, can give a unique texture.

Hand-build ceramic coffee dripper workshop: The ceramic coffee dripper is considered the best material for hand brewing, as ceramics keep the water temperature well during the processes, and could maintain a balanced flavor for hand-brew coffee.
Hand-build ceramic sake set workshop: In traditional eastern culture, you should choose the right ware for the right food or drink, in order to show your respect for nature.

summary: Tie-dye has a long history. Originated from the Yellow River Basin. It is still uncertain when it originated. title: Russian Nesting Doll (Matryoshka) Workshop, Hong Kong
description: Create your own Russian doll right in the heart of Hong Kong with this workshop! Choose a character and handpaint the body with tools from Aura Art. Get discounts on the workshop when you book through Klook!
summary: Hong Kong is a melting pot of cultures, which is why it's no surprise that even the Russian nesting doll has made its way to the bustling metropolis. Known as 'matryoshka' in its motherland, this folk toy is a set of wooden dolls fitted inside each other in a descending order. Each doll follows a theme - may it be political, a slice of life, or even pop culture. Try your hand at traditional Russian nesting doll-making with this workshop by Aura Art. Head over their studio in Central and be greeted by a friendly multilingual tutor. A short briefing will ensue and samples will be given as your guide throughout the class. Follow the tutor's step-by-step process for better results but feel free to have your way with your own set of dolls. Play around with colors and tools as you create a theme that personally interests you or speaks of your personality. Make sure to take home your finished set as souvenir - an interesting home decor with Russian origins, yet filled with memories of Hong Kong. Capture this intercultural experience in adorable wooden pieces when you book this workshop through Klook!
highlights: Learn how to paint Russian nesting dolls in less than two hours with this workshop!
Create your own theme or be inspired by your favorite characters from movies, cartoons, or TV shows
Feel at ease during the class as your expert tutor guides your group throughout the entire workshop
Show off your matryoshka doll's handpainted details and expressions to loved ones back home
Try other traditional art workshops, such as Chinese Painting, Printmaking, Neon Light Art, or Mosaic Art

summary:
Class Descriptions:
1. Full-Body Sculpting
Sculpt and tone your entire body with high-frequency, low-impact exercises. Target your arms, thighs, and especially your glutes and abdomen. Experience the burning sensation and muscle tremors as you work out!
2. High-Intensity Cardio + Pilates
The first half of the class consists of high-intensity exercises with short rest periods, creating a calorie-burning effect and strengthening your core muscles. The second half focuses on Pilates exercises on the mat, targeting deep muscles, correcting body posture, and emphasizing control of the core muscle group.
3. Barre Workout
Barre is a popular body-shaping exercise derived from the US. It combines elements of ballet, Pilates, yoga, and incorporates equipment such as resistance balls, resistance bands, and dumbbells. Through high-frequency, low-impact movements, this workout effectively trains every muscle group in your body, enhances stability and control of your core muscles, sculpts your body lines, boosts metabolism, and improves body alignment.

description: Immerse yourself in the flow of color and unleash your artistic potential! Our fluid art workshop will take you to experience an artistic feast of color and flow!
summary:
Immerse yourself in the flow of color and unleash your artistic potential!
Our fluid art workshop will take you to experience an artistic feast of color and flow! No painting background is required, you just need to relax, express your creativity, and create unique works of art in the flow of paint.
The workshop will provide professional instruction and materials so you can easily master the techniques of fluid art and create stunning works of art. You will learn the mixing techniques of different paints, fluid art creation techniques, and how to post-process your works.

summary: JUST BE (Art and Culture Workshop) is located in the Art Village at Ma Wan 1868, Tsim Sha Tsui and Kwai Chung. Through rich and diversified art courses, it allows students to demonstrate their creativity and expression skills. It is very popular among parents and children, couples, friends gatherings, birthday celebrations, schools, companies and organizations. JUST BE Art and Culture Workshop includes: Color tie-dyeing | Turkish mosaic lamp | Turkish coffee experience | Art jamming | Fluid painting | Glass colored night light | Floating vase | Environmental art | TUFTING | Neon light cold light art | Bean puzzle | Film photography and printing | Hanfu | Chinese painting | Fashion design | Makeup course | Painting course | Ink painting course | Watercolor course | Handicraft workshop | Paper art | Weaving | Parent-child workshop | STEM course | Electronic keyboard | Handpan | Guitar | Hawaiian guitar | Indian accordion | Indian midanga drum | Floating vase | Intangible cultural heritage floating lacquer fan | Outreach service | Tailor-made | Door-to-door service | Parent-child mini chef | Artisan coffee baking | Delicious cookies | Special cheesecake. When you come to the Art Village in Ma Wan, which combines natural ecological environment, art, historical and cultural elements, you can experience JUST BE art activities. There are also Noah’s Ark and beaches, special outdoor activity venues such as wild camps and leisure farms, as well as retail and dining venues nearby. It has become diversified and injected colorful into public life. It is very suitable for everyone to come for a day trip to relax their body and mind. JUST BE in the moment “live in the present” to feel everything in the present, focus on the experience in front of you, and savor the small beauty in life. Let’s encourage each other!
highlights: JUST BE Art Jamming【Exclusive free Little Flow Bear Workshop】—Ma Wan Art Village, Hong Kong
Art Jamming is an art-making activity in which students work together to create art in a relaxed, fun environment and share their creations with others.
Art Jamming originated in the United States in the early 20th century and became a popular art and cultural activity in Asia, especially in Hong Kong and Singapore.
IRREGULart provides a space, canvases, brushes, and other supplies for students to create their own works of art with no experience required.
Art Jamming is particularly suitable for friends, couples, families, and parent-child workshops to enhance relationships.

title: Mother-of-pearl Inlay Workshop in Hong Kong
description: Bring the rainbow of shells home
summary: Mother-of-pearl inlay is a traditional decorative technique that originated in China's Shang Dynasty. It uses the iridescent material of the inner layer of shells to inlay on the surface of objects, creating a colorful visual effect. Its craftsmanship carries the Eastern philosophy of "harmony between man and nature", showing both the spirituality of natural materials and the craftsmen's ultimate pursuit of details.
highlights: Culture and craftsmanship: Experience traditional Chinese culture, learn about the historical origins of mother-of-pearl, the characteristics of its materials (such as the selection of luminous shells and pearl shells), and the inlay techniques, and understand its artistic language of "using shells as ink".
Hands-on experience: Participate in the craftsmanship from shell selection, design to inlaying.
Take away unique pieces: Finished products such as butterfly brooches and bracelets are both artistic and practical, suitable as gifts or personal collections.
Recommended for couples and besties: Make accessories for each other yourself (more classy than couple outfits!).
Welcome corporate teambuilding or organization appointments, please WhatsApp us for corporate discounts

images.description: The iridescence of each piece of mother-of-pearl perfectly matches the pattern.
The mother-of-pearl inlay decoration technique is used in the details.
There are many natural mother-of-pearl shells to choose from, showing blue, green, purple and other changing luster under different light
The crystal colorful lights shining in the subtle details correspond to the overall pink color, reflecting the unique majestic beauty of art.
Zero threshold! Newbies can also make high-end accessories

title: Float Co. HK Spa Experience (Float On Hong Kong)
description: Try the float therapy at Float Co. (Float On Hong Kong) to experience the therapeutic benefits of sensory deprivation. Book Float HK spa here for great deals!
summary: Floating sessions have become rapidly popular all over the world for its therapeutic benefits. Scientific studies have shown that there is something extremely soothing about being able to float in the water in perfect peace, silence, and isolation, calling back to how infants calmly floated during gestation, away from the stresses of the world. Floating pods have come to Hong Kong, allowing you to experience a 60-minute of tranquility within the pod. A perfect escape from the stress and fast paced life of the city. The complete calm and zero-gravity environment offers you the ability to let go of the world while in a peaceful isolation. First timers need not worry as there will be a orientation before each guest enters the pod. After the therapy, you'll find yourself emerging splendidly relaxed from the pod. Regular cold plunge sessions can help you achieve all these benefits and more. Join us at Float Co and take the plunge into cold water therapy. title: Hong Kong Fisherman's Wharf | Fisherfolk Experience Centre Pier 6
description: Discover Hong Kong's fishing heritage at Fisherfolk Experience Centre Pier 6. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of Aberdeen Fish Dawn Market!
summary: Pier Fishing Experience + Aberdeen 1773 | Audio-guided Boat Tour + Houseboat Visit. Gather at PIER 6 in Aberdeen Fishing Village, then board Jumbo sightseeing wooden boat. Listen to the audio guide as you pass by various iconic landmarks in the fishing village, including the Tai Pak Seafood Restaurant, the Aberdeen Boat Club, and traditional shipyards. Visit the former water dwelling “Aberdeen Floating Village,” gaining insights into the lives of fishermen. Experience a themed boat docked next to the pier (not for sailing), where you can use fish traps and bait. Immerse yourself in the daily life of fishermen while fishing quietly in the typhoon shelter, enjoying the sea breeze, the rhythm of fishing, and a moment of tranquility. Includes traditional local snack and drink, insurance.
highlights: Pier Fishing Experience + Aberdeen 1773 | Audio-guided Boat Tour + Houseboat Visit
